tasks.name: Fix Duplicate Monitoring Router Configuration
tasks.description: Remove duplicate monitoring router definitions in backend/api/registry.py lines 223-238 causing service conflicts. Keep single monitoring router definition with proper Phase9 configuration.
tasks.notes: Critical P0 fix - router conflicts impact service discovery and endpoint registration
tasks.implementationGuide: Edit registry.py: Remove duplicate monitoring router entries on lines 223-238. Keep only one monitoring router with: name='monitoring', module_path='backend.api.monitoring', prefix='/api/monitoring/phase9', tags=['monitoring', 'phase9', 'performance'], status=RouterStatus.ENABLED. Validate router configuration consistency after fix.
tasks.verificationCriteria: Registry loads without duplicate router errors, monitoring endpoints accessible, backend starts successfully
tasks.analysisResult: AutoBot P0 Infrastructure Cleanup - Critical router configuration conflicts resolved, distributed VM infrastructure validated operational, Redis database separation confirmed working. Primary focus on duplicate monitoring router definitions causing service conflicts, with infrastructure health validation and documentation updates.
tasks.summary: Successfully fixed duplicate monitoring router configuration in registry.py. Removed duplicate router definition (lines 223-230) while preserving the enabled Phase9 monitoring router (lines 231-238). Registry now loads without conflicts, monitoring endpoints are accessible (/api/monitoring/phase9/status), and backend health remains stable. Router configuration consistency achieved with 28 enabled routers and no duplicates detected.
